config.description: Initial GA test with pop=15, gen=10

tuning_runs.notes: OVER BUDGET by 4.8 min. Score -0.0073 vs baseline (1.1688). GA is slower and less accurate than CMA-ES.
Still OVER BUDGET by 1.5 min. Score even worse -0.0139 vs baseline. Fewer generations = less convergence.

config.description: Minimal GA with small pop=8, gen=5

tuning_runs.notes: OVER BUDGET by 2.3 min. Score much worse -0.0463 vs baseline. Smaller population = fewer valid candidates hurting diversity bonus.

conclusion: FAILED - Genetic Algorithm is fundamentally inferior to CMA-ES for continuous optimization. All runs over budget with worse scores. GA's random crossover/mutation is less directed than CMA-ES's adaptive covariance learning. Even minimal GA configs (pop=8, gen=5) exceed budget with much worse accuracy. Mark alternative_optimizer family as EXHAUSTED.
